intro: Gynostemma crenulatum, commonly known as the creeping gynostemma, is a perennial climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils that aid in climbing. The plant has heart-shaped, serrated leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. It is known for its medicinal properties, with parts of the plant used in traditional herbal remedies. Its botanical features make it a unique and valuable species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
